channel.title: Piedmont on Blanka's Travel Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Piedmont on Blanka's Travel Blog

item.title: Cuneo & Saluzzo
item.description: La Granda. That’s the nickname of the Provincia di Cuneo. It is not because it sooo great - it has just the biggest territory.

item.title: Susa Valley
item.description: Ahh another mountain valley. I love them. They are perfect example of how these geographical barriers create special societies, which flourish not just culturally and socially, but also economically.

item.title: Bra and Alba
item.description: I know it is surprising, but Bra has nothing to with langeries, and Alba is not named after Jessica Alba.

item.title: Omegna, Orta San Giulio
item.description: There are a few lakes in Italy hugged by the Alps which create a completely different vibe from the usual Mediterranean atmosphere.

item.title: Ivrea
item.description: Ivrea is north of Torino, close to the border with Aosta but still part of Torino Metropolitan Area.

item.title: Vercelli
item.description: We already payed a visit to Vercelli a few weeks ago.

item.title: Asti
item.description: Just 30 minutes from Torino, the nest of the cultural elite can be found: Asti.

item.title: Torino
item.description: I would have never imagined that one can find it pleasant to live in a big city.
